messages.subject: Renting video games, just like netflix
messages.msgSnippet: Hey guess what I just found??!! Gamefly.com You can rent games.  Its just like netflix.  You get 2 at a time, no late fees etc etc.  Its about $22/month I
messages.messageBody:
Hey guess what I just found??!!

Gamefly.com

You can rent games. Its just like netflix. You get 2 at a time, no late fees etc etc. Its about $22/month I think.

We're going to try it.

Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: Fetteroll
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, August 18, 2004 2:25 PM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: The Gimmes


on 8/18/04 10:36 AM, Aimee at aimeel73@... wrote:

> I suggested selling some, a while ago, so that he
> could get new games, but you get so little money for
> them, compared to what you paid for them, that it
> doesn't make much sense to him to get rid of them.

Depends on the game! Some of them hold their value very well. There are some
games for the SNES (which came out, maybe, 10 years ago?) that go for $30 or
more. Of course lots are only sold for a $1 or $2.

It all depends.

Joyce
